body.p: In the simulation, when we are building a sampling distribution, what does each dot represent in the graph?

feedback.p: Incorrect. You are right that we are collecting samples of individual babies, but we are graphing a result for each sample. Please try again
Correct. Each sample is represented in the sampling distribution with a dot at its x-bar value.
Incorrect. We are collecting random samples from the population of babies, but we are graphing a result for each sample. Please try again

hint.p: Run the animation again and focus on the graph being built on top right. Each dot represents a summary statistic of a sample of how many babies?
